description:
there are some problem when restart compute. it will not automatic start instance when host reboot.

we can add following flag to enable automatic rebooting:
resume_guests_state_on_host_boot
start_guests_on_host_boot

there are some other problem:
1. what's the mean of resume_guests_state_on_host_boot?
suspend <--> resume
pause <--> unpause
if we suspend a instance, it should not resume automatically by compute.

2. if we only restart the compute but not restart the host, the instance is still running, but the compute will reboot it again
title: action to instance after compute restart

comments.content:
here is code for these two flags:

    cfg.BoolOpt('start_guests_on_host_boot',
                default=False,
                help='Whether to restart guests when the host reboots'),
    cfg.BoolOpt('resume_guests_state_on_host_boot',
                default=False,
                help='Whether to start guests that were running before the '
                     'host rebooted'),

i think the name of these two flag should change to:

start_guests_on_host_boot -> restart_guests_on_host_boot
resume_guests_state_on_host_boot -> start_guests_on_host_boot
